title: Looking for a serif face similar to the Chloe type signature
content:
Hey everyone!  
I guess it's an easy one, isn't it?...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131228011003im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chloe_4694.jpg)
author: drduckling

comments.content:
We had this before, and concluded that this is a custom design.

[http://www.typophile.com/node/30741](http://web.archive.org/web/20131228011003/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30741)
And you can download the Adobe illustrater logo file from [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131228011003/http:/brandsoftheworld.com/search/?action=search&text=Chlo%C3%A9).

but what if i wanted to mimick this font as closely as possible in creating a different logo? so far the closest font i can find is plantin bold. any other suggestions? thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131228011003im_/http:/typophile.com/files/plantin_chloe_4241.jpg)

Minion Bold as a possible starting point? Would need quite a bit of 'feminisation' though.

Hello? I edited this post and now it's at the bottom of the thread. Anyone else had this kind of bug?

Minion bold is pretty good, thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131228011003im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chloe_minionbold_6192.jpg)

So is this font Chelsea RR bold which I had never heard of before....

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131228011003im_/http:/typophile.com/files/chelsearrbold_6037.jpg)

The look may differ when written white on black or black on white. Here is the Chloé logo black on white:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131228011003im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ChloeLogo_5965.gif)
Yeah that is strange, because I replied to your Minion bold earlier, and now that is gone....
This has been happening since the major upgrade a while ago. The powers that be are working to correct that, but everyone's at TypeCon Seattle right now, so let's refrain from editing for now. ;^)
